intro: Pilosella malacotricha, commonly known as the Malacotricha whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and roadsides. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are usually hairy and narrow. Pilosella malacotricha is often found in temperate climates and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
